III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member engaged in sexual intercourse with a youth placed
at facility.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Supervisor 1 was interviewed via phone on
5/3/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 1
reported she was outside with Youth A on 4/19/23 and Youth A
was upset. Youth A turned to Supervisor 1 and said “You know
what? I’m just going to tell you. Youth B was bragging to me a
month ago that you came onto him when you were alone in the
milieu and then you went into his room with him, and you guys
had sex”. Youth A told Supervisor 1 Youth B told Youth C the
information as well. Supervisor 1 reported she has never been
inappropriate or had sex with Youth B. Supervisor 1 reported this
was the first time she had ever heard allegations or discussions of
this subject. Supervisor 1 reported Youth B has never been
inappropriate with her and typically he’s the one who shuts other
youth down when they are speaking about anything sexually
inappropriate. Supervisor 1 reported Campus-Wide Supervisors
do not stay back in the homes with youth if they do not go on
outings and she can’t remember a time when she was ever alone
with Youth B. She also denied ever having her bra off at work or
putting her bra in Youth C’s suitcase.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via phone on 5/3/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 2 reported
Supervisor 1 interacts the same with Youth B as she does with all
the other youth. Supervisor 2 reported Supervisor 1 has never
been inappropriate or crossed any boundaries with youth.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 4/24/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported about a
month ago, Youth B told her he and Supervisor 1 had hooked up.
Youth A stated Youth B said he and Supervisor 1 were alone at
the facility together because he didn’t go on an outing, and they
were sitting in the milieu. Youth A reported Youth B didn’t give a
timeframe or date for when this occurred. Youth A reported Youth
B said Supervisor 1 was coming onto him and physically touching
him, so Youth B asked Supervisor 1 if she wanted to take it to his
2

room and she said yes. When they were in his room, they had
sex. Youth A reported she does not believe anything ever
happened because Supervisor 1 because she doesn’t seem like
the kind of person who would do that because she is very
professional. Youth A said she was being slut-shamed around
campus, so she told Supervisor 1 about the allegations so the
same thing wouldn’t happen to her. Youth A reported another time
Youth B and Youth C were talking about Supervisor 1’s bra cup
size and Youth B told Youth A Supervisor 1 left her bra in Youth
C’s suitcase one time. Youth A reported after she told Supervisor
1 about the allegations, Supervisor 1 told Youth A she wasn’t
comfortable being around Youth B if these things are being
discussed. Youth A reported Supervisor 1 is a comfort and
confidant for Youth B and Youth A wanted to get back at Youth B
for a personal issue between them. Youth A wanted to take
Supervisor 1 away from Youth B so he didn’t have someone close
to talk to and he could hurt the same way Youth B hurt Youth A.
Youth B was interviewed via phone on 4/27/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported he and Youth A were in a
relationship which didn’t end well. Youth B reported Supervisor 1
has always been appropriate with him and no boundaries have
ever been crossed between the two of them. Youth B stated the
only physical contact he has ever had with Supervisor 1 is a hug
and he has never told anyone, including Youth A, there has been
anything more. Youth B reported he has never heard about
Supervisor 1 leaving her bra in any youths’ rooms or having her
bra off in any youths’ rooms. He reported youth are very immature
and like to make up stories.
Youth C was interviewed via phone on 5/15/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported he has never heard
about and does not have any information regarding an
inappropriate relationship between Supervisor 1 and Youth B.
Youth C reported he does not believe either of them would ever
cross a boundary. Youth C reported Supervisor 1 has never been
in his room with her bra off or left her bra in his suitcase. Youth C
reported he was upset he was brought into this situation and was
shocked anyone would ever make up all these ridiculous
allegations.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
- D.A. Blodgett St. John’s Youth Development Specialist
Procedures (rev. 2/2022) outlines the duties and roles for
staff and supervisors employed at the facility, including
3

personal and professional boundaries staff/supervisors
must adhere to.
- Agency Response Plan: One-on-one check ins between
youth and staff should not occur in youth bedrooms.
Supervisor 1 will not work in Cebelak House during the
investigation. Supervisor 1 will not be alone with youth
during the investigation.
- Supervisor 1 has one discipline record in her employee file
unrelated to this investigation. Supervisor 1 completed
Residential Team Professional Boundaries training on
3/10/22.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as during interviews with Youth
B, Youth C and Staff 1 they all deny any sexually inappropriate
interactions.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
